API Documentation

Binding.Bind(self, **kwargs)

Applies an function to calculate the fraction of occupited receptors at equilibrium.

Parameters

  • receptor_conc – Required (kwarg flt): concentration of receptor

  • lig_conc_range – Required (kwarg array): array of range of ligand concentration

  • pKd – Required (kwarg flt): pKd value of the ligand

Binding.ShowCurve(self)

Plots ligand-target binding curve

Binding.SubMaxConcentration(self)

Calculates the maximum bending point of a sigmoid-shaped curve according to the mathod of Sebaugh et al., 2003.

Parameters

  • drug_receptor – Required (int): concentration of the receptor

  • lig_conc_range – Required (array): array of a range of ligand concentration

Returns

instance .submax_concentration (flt)

Note

The minimization uses the Nelder-Mead method.

class Simulation.Activation

Simulation of the activation of signaling pathways (i.e. activation by agonists)

Analysis()

This function calculates the dose-response effect.

Returns

instance of processed_data

PathwayParameters()

Display table with default pathway parameters.

Warning

this functions requires the qgrid library. It doens’t work on Google Colab.

PathwayParametersToCSV(path)

Export pathway parameters into CSV format.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

PotencyToCSV(path)

Exports the potency values into csv format.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path to save the csv file

PotencyToDict()

Convert potencies into a dictionary.

Reactions()

Display pathway reactions.

Run()

This function runs the pathway simulation and returns the raw simulation data.

SetSimulationParameters(**kwargs)
Parameters

  • ligands – Required (kwargs list): list of ligands’ names (str)

  • affinities – Required (kwargs list): list of pKd values (flt)

  • pathway – Required (kwargs str): name of the pathway (‘Gs’, ‘Gi’, ‘Gq’)

  • receptor_conc – Required (kwargs flt): receptors concentration (nM)

  • lig_conc_range – Required (kwargs array): range of ligands’ concentration

  • ttotal – Required (kwargs int): simulation time (seconds)

  • nsteps – Required (kwargs int): simulation time step

  • binding_kinetics – Optional (kwargs boolean): default (False)

Warning

the order of the lists of ligands names and affinities list must be the same.

ShowCurve(save=False, filename=None)

Plots the dose-response curve.

ShowPotency()

Return the potency values as a pandas DataFrame.

UserPathwayParameters(path)

Import user pathway parameters.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

class Simulation.FitModel

Fit a model to experimental data.

Note

This class was developed to reproduce data from a specific experimental setup. Please see tutorial 4 (OXTR pathay). Use carefully!

PathwayParameters()

Display table with default pathway parameters.

Warning

this functions requires the qgrid library. It doens’t work on Google Colab.

PathwayParametersToCSV(path)

Export pathway parameters into CSV format.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

PlotIterations(save=False, filename=None)

Plot iterations.

Reactions()

Display pathway reactions.

Run(**kwargs)

Fits of the model to experimental data.

Parameters

  • expratio – Required (kwargs flt): experimental signalling specie concentration ratio

  • target_parameter – Required (kwargs str):kinetic parameter to me modified

  • maxiter – Required (kwargs int): maximum number of iteration

  • seed – Required (kwargs flt): ramdom seed for scaling the modified parameter

  • seed_incrementor – Required (kwargs flt): seed incrementor (each iteration will increment the seed by this value)

  • seed_decrementor – Required (kwargs flt): seed decrementor (each iteration will decrement the seed by this value)

SetSimulationParameters(**kwargs)
Parameters

  • pathway_parameters – Required (kwargs): dict of pathway parameters

  • pathway – Required (kwargs str): name of the pathway (‘Gs’, ‘Gi’, ‘Gq’)

  • ttotal – Required (kwargs int): simulation time (seconds)

  • nsteps – Required (kwargs int): simulation time step

  • observable – Required (kwargs str): molecular specie to be measured

Returns

instances of all parameters

ShowGraphs(save=False, filename=None)

Plot the amount of obeservable in function of time, Amplitude, Area Under the Curve, and Full Width at Half Maximum.

Parameters

  • save – Optional (kwarg boolean): default False

  • filename – Optional (kwarg str)

UserPathwayParameters(path)

Import user pathway parameters.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

class Simulation.Inhibition

Simulation of the inhibition of signaling pathways (i.e. inhibition by antagonists).

Analysis()

This function calculates the dose-response effect.

Returns

instance processed_data

PathwayParameters()

Display table with default pathway parameters.

Warning

this functions requires the qgrid library. It doens’t work on Google Colab.

PathwayParametersToCSV(path)

Export pathway parameters into CSV format.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

PotencyToCSV(path)

Exports the potency values into csv format.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path to save the csv file

PotencyToDict()

Convert potencies into a dictionary.

Reactions()

Display pathway reactions.

Run()

This function runs the pathway simulation and returns the raw simulation data.

SetSimulationParameters(**kwargs)
Parameters

  • agonist – Required (kwargs str): agonist name

  • agonist_affinity – Required (kwargs flt): agonist pKd value

  • agonist_submaximal_conc – Required (kwargs flt): agonist submaximal concentration

  • antagonists – Required (kwargs list):list of antagonists names (str)

  • antagonists_affinities – Required (kwargs list): list of antagonists affinity values (flt)

  • antagonists_conc_range – Required (kwargs array): range of ligands’ concentration (nM)

  • pathway – Required (kwargs str): name of the pathway (‘Gs’, ‘Gi’, ‘Gq’)

  • receptor_conc – Required (kwargs flt): receptors concentration (nM)

  • ttotal – Required (kwargs int): simulation time (seconds)

  • nsteps – Required (kwargs int): simulation time step

  • kinetics – Optional (kwargs boolean): default (False)

Returns

instances of all parameters

Warning

the order of the lists of the antagonists names and affinities list must be the same.

ShowCurve(save=False, filename=None)

Plot the dose-response curve.

ShowPotency()

Return the potency values as a pandas DataFrame.

UserPathwayParameters(path)

Import user pathway parameters.

Parameters

path – Required (kwarg str): directory path

Simulation.pathways_path = '/home/rribeiro/Projects/SSBtoolkit/ssbtoolkit/pathways'

Module to simulate the mathematical models of the signaling pathways.

Utils.CalcOccupancy(receptor_conc, agonist_conc, antagonist_conc, pkd_agonist, pkd_antagonist)

This function calculates the fraction of occupited receptors at equilibrium.

Parameters

  • receptor_conc – Required (int): concentration of the receptor

  • agonists_conc – Required (int): concentration of the agonist

  • antagonists_conc – Required (int): concentration of the antagonists (0 if antagonist shoul not be considered)

  • pkd_agonist – Required (int): pKd of agonist

  • pkd_antagonist – Required (int): pKd of antagonists (if antagonist shoul not be considered)

Return int

fraction of occupied receptors in the equilibrium

Utils.GetGProtein(uniprotID)

This function query the SSBtoolkit internal database to extract the G protein associated to GPCR.

Warning

it just works for Human GPCRS!

Parameters

uniprotID – Required (str)

Returns

(str)

Utils.KineticTempScale(kon, koff, T1, T2, Tu='K', *kwargs)

This function rescales the kinetics constants to a specific temperature.

Parameters

  • kon – Required (flt): foward kinetic constant

  • koff – Required (flt): reverse kinetic constant

  • T1 – Required (flt): Initial temperature

  • T2 – Required (flt): Final temperature

Paramter Tu

Optional (kwarg str): Temperature Units (kelvin=’K’, celsius=’C’)

Returns

(flt, flt)

Utils.MicrogramsToNanomolar(uniprotID, concentration)

This function converts micrograms of protein in nanomolar.

Parameters

  • uniprotID – Required (str)

  • concentration – Required (int): concentration od protein in micrograms

Returns

(flt) concentration of protein in nM

Note

This function will obtain the sequence of the protein from UNIPROT and calculate automatically its molecular mass

Utils.PrintProgressBar(iteration, total, prefix='', suffix='', decimals=1, length=100, fill='█', printEnd='\r')

Call in a loop to create terminal progress bar

Parameters

  • iteration:Required – current iteration (Int)

  • total – Required: total iterations (Int)

  • prefix – Optional: prefix string (Str)

  • suffix – Optional: suffix string (Str)

  • decimals – Optional: positive number of decimals in percent complete (Int)

  • length – Optional: character length of bar (Int)

  • fill – Optional: bar fill character (Str)

  • printEnd – Optional: end character (Str)

class Utils.tauRAMD

Implementation of the tRAMD method by Kokh et al., 2018.

PlotRTDistribuitons(save=False, filename=None)

Plots the residence time distributions

Parameters

  • save – Optional (kwarg boolean): default False

  • filename – Optional (kwarg str)

PlotRTStats(save=False, filename=None)

Plots the residence time statistics

Parameters

  • save – Optional (kwarg boolean): default False

  • filename – Optional (kwarg str)

Run(**kwargs)

Calulates the residence time of a ligand from RAMD simualtions.

Parameters

  • prefix – Required (kwarg str): directory path of .dat files

  • dt – Optional (kwarg flt): MD simulations time step in ns (defaul is 2E-6)

  • softwr – Optional (kwarg str): software used to perform RAMD simulations: NAMD, GROMACS (default)

Return (str)

residence time
